nodes.text: How are things going for you?
I did quite well on the first exam for class... But then the Master said he'd be watching next time to see if I cheated. I didn't cheat. I just studied very hard.
I don't think that the Master was talking about you when he mentioned cheating. He was looking at Sosi and Kyro when he mentioned it.
Oh, that's a relief. I wouldn't want the Master to think badly of me.
Thomas - this is a ROGUE Class... Of course the Master thinks people cheat on the test. He encourages it. It's what Rogues do.
Read any good books lately?
I've been reading about the history of this castle. It's pretty fascinating.
The Knights Luminar built this castle to prevent a rift from opening up in Sardonia that would have released Dark Ones into this world.
Then, the Knights Luminar were betrayed by traitors who wanted to open the rift barrier. There was a terrible battle here. Apparently some of the Chaos Realm leaked into this world.
There were warnings in the book that there are dangerous sections of this castle that were walled off and that should never again be opened.
I guess we need to be careful when we're exploring this place. Who knows what we'll find?
Did you talk with Esme about her test results yet?
I spoke with Esme briefly after supper. We're going to get together and I'll tutor her how to read the Master's writings.

nodes.name: Every Little Bit Helps
nodes.description: Yay - sounds like Thomas is going to help Esme with tests. I'm sure they'll figure out something. I'd hate for Esme to have to leave when she doesn't want to. Not too sure about me, though. I guess I'm starting to like it here.

nodes.text: It was really kind of you to tell me about Esme's problem. I should have noticed it myself. I guess I'm too concerned about doing well in class and need to pay more attention to doing Good, instead.
Thank you for teaching me this lesson, Shawn.
Did you see notice how upset Esme was about the Exam? Turns out, she has trouble reading and is afraid that she'll be kicked out of school.
I assumed that Esme failed the exam because she just forgot to study for it. I should have realized that there was more to the problem. Maybe if she talks to the Master, he'll go easy on her.
I think she's afraid that when Master finds out she can't read, he'll just kick her out of school.
That's not right. I'm sure the Master will work something out with her.
Why don't you talk it over with her? Maybe you can help her. Seems like something a Paladin would do.
You're right about that. I really should try to help Esme with her difficulty. I'll have to talk to her about it later.

nodes.name: Every Little Bit Helps
nodes.description: Yay - sounds like Thomas is going to help Esme with tests. I'm sure they'll figure out something. I'd hate for Esme to have to leave when she doesn't want to. Not too sure about me, though. I guess I'm starting to like it here.

nodes.text: It's really thoughtful of you to be so concerned about Esme.
Esme was certainly upset about her test results in class.
I felt so sorry for her when the Master singled her out in front of everyone. She still seemed upset over supper. Maybe I should say something to her to find out what her problem was with the test.

options.text: Say that Esme is Your Girlfriend

nodes.text: Hey, watch yourself - Esme is MY girlfriend.
Oh. So you are helping Esme, then?
<shrug> I'm trying to help her.
I'm sure she'd appreciate some help with her studies. No one wants to face the Master's wrath.
What about you - you had trouble with the test, too. Do you need help with it?
<shrug> It was just one test. I'll probably do better on the next one.

options.text: Tell Thomas to Let Esme Solve Her Own Problem

nodes.text: Hey, Esme is a big girl now. She should solve her own problems. If she wants your help, she can ask for it.
I guess you are correct.
You are one of the smartest people I've ever met, and you're also one of the kindest. It feels good to be around you. I should hang out with you more often.
Oh.. thank you. You're a very... interesting... person.
You're a very bright person. We should spend more time together.
If you'd like to study with me, that would be good. It's always good to have other viewpoints on lessons, particularly Disbarred Bard lessons.
So you're a cute guy - why don't we hang out together? Maybe we could check out the garden in the moonlight...
Um.. no... I have to study for the tests, you know. Sorry. I'm too busy.
See you tomorrow.
Good night, Shawn. Sleep tight.
And don't let the bedbugs bite!
